+34% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_GOLD] Gold output. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built in Global Cities.

Replace.Text: Libary is a Public Education building which can boost both the city's [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output by enhancing the quality of its [ICON_CITIZEN] Population. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pay extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built in Small Cities.

Public School is a Public Education building which can boost both the city's [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output by enhancing the quality of its [ICON_CITIZEN] Population. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pay extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built in Large Cities.

Mughal Mosque is a Public Education building which can boost both the city's [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output by enhancing the quality of its [ICON_CITIZEN] Population. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in this City. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]No extra [ICON_GOLD] Gold Maintenance. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must be built in Medium Cities. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+100% religious pressure in the citiy.

Row.Text: [ICON_GREAT_ARTIST] Bollywood

Bollywood is the sobriquet for the Hindi language film industry based in Mumbai, the most populous city of the Republic of India. The term is often loosely used as a synecdoche to refer to the whole of Indian cinema; however, Bollywood proper is only a part of the large Indian film industry, which includes other production centres producing films in many languages.
+50% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The empire will immediately enter a Golden Age everytime when a Bollywood is built.

Replace.Text: Friendly AI with no bonuses. Equals "Prince".
Calm AI with little bonuses on Growth, Production, Gold and Happiness.
Indifferent AI with medium bonuses on Growth, Production, Gold, Happiness and Combat.
Callous AI with medium bonuses on Growth, Production, Gold, Happiness and Combat. AI will get stronger when you enter a new era.
Aggressive AI with large bonuses on Growth, Production, Gold, Happiness and Combat. AI start with 2 settlers and AI will get stronger when you enter a new era. Equals "Deity".
Ferocious AI with great bonuses on Growth, Production, Gold, Happiness and Combat. AI start with 2 settlers and AI will get even stronger when you enter a new era.
Crazy AI with huge bonuses on Growth, Production, Gold, Happiness and Combat. AI start with 3 settlers and AI will get much more stronger when you enter a new era.
Insane AI with insane bonuses on Growth, Production, Gold, Happiness and Combat. AI start with 4 settlers and AI will get on steroids when you enter a new era.

Row.Text: Unknown Resource
Manpower

In SuperPower Mod, military units and world wonders require a certain amount of [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower to maintain. If you have abundant [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower, the [ICON_GOLD] Gold cost for purchasing units and buildings will be reduced due to the lower cost of labor value.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]1. The use of Manpower: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Building regular army units. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Building World Wonders.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]2. How to acquire Manpower: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Cities will provide lots of [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower, which is its main source. Cities with larger population sizes will provide more [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Engineer specialists in your cities will produce a small amount of [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower. (+2 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower per Engineer) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Some buildings with an icon of [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower will provide a small amount of Consumer Goods on their own. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]You may also acquire [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower from other civilizations by trading or allied city-states.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]3. The Global Effects of Manpower: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]If you have abundant [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower (more than [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25[ENDCOLOR]), you will receive a discount for the [ICON_GOLD] cost for purchasing units and buildings according to the total number of cities you own (maximum -35%, can multiply with other effects). Here is the math: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]P= n/(c*2)*5 (round down by 5) [NEWLINE](P:the discount percentage of [ICON_GOLD] cost for purchasing units and buildings; n:the number of [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower you currently have; c: the total number of cities you own)
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For example, if you have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]50[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower and own 5 cities. You will receive a bonus of -25% [ICON_GOLD] cost for purchasing units and buildings (P=50/(5*2)*5=25).
Electricity

In SuperPower Mod, after entering the Electric Era, the Electricity System will be functional. [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity is a very important resource in the late-game. A modern civilization cannot survive without enough power supply.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]1. The use of Electricity: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]City population size. Larger cities will consume more [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Almost every post-industrial building requires a certain amount of [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity to be built.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]2. How to acquire Electricity: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Power Plants buildings (with an icon of [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY]) is the only source of [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity. Be aware that most of the Power Plants buildings will cause Pollution to the city which slow down the population growth. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]You may also acquire [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity from other civilizations by trading or allied city-states.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]3. The Global Effects of Electricity:
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]If the number of [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity is negative (lower than [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]0[ENDCOLOR]), you will receive [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science penalty by percentage according to the total number of cities you own. Here is the math: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]P= n*(c/10) [NEWLINE](P:the additional percentage of [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science penalty caused by the number of negative [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity; n:the number of negative [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity; c: the total number of cities you own) [NEWLINE]the upper limit is decided by post-modern technologies you have researched: each technology in or above the modern era you own will add -5% (maximum -75%)
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]On the contrary, if you have abundant [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity (more than [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25[ENDCOLOR]), you will receive [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science bonus by percentage (the limit is decided by post-modern technologies you have researched) according to the total number of cities you own. Here is the math: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]P= n/c [NEWLINE](P:the additional percentage of [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science penalty caused by the number of [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity you currently have; n:the number of negative [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity; c: the total number of cities you own) [NEWLINE]the upper limit is decided by post-modern technologies you have researched: each technology in or above the modern era you own will add +5% (maximum +50%)
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For example, if you have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]50[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity, own 5 cities and have 2 post-modern technologies. You will receive a bonus of +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output (P=50/5=10). [NEWLINE]If you have [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-50[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity, you will receive a penalty of -10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output (P=50*(5/10)=25). [NEWLINE]However if you have [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-150[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity, you will still receive a penalty of -10% because you only have 2 post-modern technologies, which means the upper limit is -10%.

Electric power is the rate at which electrical energy is transferred by an electric circuit. The SI unit of power is the watt, one joule per second.Electric power is usually produced by electric generators, but can also be supplied by sources such as electric batteries. It is generally supplied to businesses and homes by the electric power industry through an electric power grid. Electric power is usually sold by the kilowatt hour (3.6 MJ) which is the product of power in kilowatts multiplied by running time in hours. Electric utilities measure power using an electricity meter, which keeps a running total of the electric energy delivered to a customer.
Consumer Goods

In SuperPower Mod, your people are not statistics, they will consume a certain amount of consumer product in their daily lives. As a result, Consumer Goods are very important. The amount of [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods you own will affect the global [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness of your nation directly.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]1. The use of Consumer Goods: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]City population size. Larger cities will consume more [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]City level: Cities further away from your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital will consume more [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]International Trade Units and Settlers.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]2. How to acquire Consumer Goods: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Merchant specialists in your cities will produce lots of [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods, which is its main source. (+4 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods per Merchant, upgradable by certain policies) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Some buildings with an icon of [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] will provide a small amount of Consumer Goods on their own. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]You may also acquire Consumer Goods from other civilizations by trading or allied city-states.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]3. The Global Effects of [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]If the number of [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods is negative (lower than [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]0[ENDCOLOR]), your people will be very unhappy due to unable to purchase their daily products and cause huge unhappiness penalty by percentage (from +5% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness to +50% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness) according to the total number of cities you own. Here is the math: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]P= n*(c/10) [NEWLINE](P:the additional percentage of [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] unhappiness caused by the number of negative [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods; n:the number of negative [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods; c: the total number of cities you own)
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]On the contrary, if you have abundant [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods (more than [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]25[ENDCOLOR]), the total unhappiness of your nation will decrease by percentage (maximum -50%[ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness). What's more, you will also receive a bonus for the [ICON_GOLD] income of [ICON_TRADE] trade routes (maximum +50%, can multiply with other effects). Both positive effects are scaled according to the total number of cities you own. Here is the math: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]P= n/c [NEWLINE](P:the reduced percentage of [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness, or the additional percentage of [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_TRADE] trade routes; n:the number of [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods you currently have; c: the total number of cities you own)
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For example, if you have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]50[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods and own 5 cities. You will receive a bonus of -10% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness and +10% [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_TRADE] trade routes (P=50/5=10). If you have [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]-50[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods, you will receive a penalty of +25% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness (P=50*(5/10)=25).

Consumer goods are goods that are ultimately consumed rather than used in the production of another good. For example, a microwave oven or a bicycle which is sold to a consumer is a final good or consumer good, whereas the components which are sold to be used in those goods are called intermediate goods.
Troops
Troops determines the upper limit number of military units.

Corps Mode:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Allows players to establish corps, combining 2 units of same type at one tile into corps, [ICON_STRENGTH]Strengh +10%, Max HP+100%. This requires the nearest city to has arsenal. You can find the action's button in unit panel.[NEWLINE] Corps units can absorb an extra unit of same type to establish Armee. [ICON_STRENGTH]Strengh +15%, Max HP+200%. This requires the nearest city to has military base.[NEWLINE] Besides, you can use great general to "upgrade" normal units to corps, with no requirements of buildings in city. The great general will be consumed then.[NEWLINE] Air forces are not able to establish corps or Armee. [NEWLINE] "Troops" resource is introduced to limit the number of combat units. [NEWLINE] Troop level high: Initially 36 troops provided for players. Cities with city size higher than "town" provide 6 extra troops per city size they acquire. [NEWLINE] Troop level medium: Initially 24 troops provided for players. Cities with city size higher than "town" provide 4 extra troops per city size they acquire(Default). [NEWLINE] Troop level low: Initially 12 troops provided for players. Cities with city size higher than "town" provide 2 extra troops per city size they acquire. [NEWLINE]
Natural Gas
In SuperPower Mod, the deep ocean without any resources can also be improved by digging out Natural Gas. It will provide additional [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output of the plot.

Natural gas is a naturally occurring hydrocarbon gas mixture consisting primarily of methane, but commonly including varying amounts of other higher alkanes, and sometimes a small percentage of carbon dioxide, nitrogen, hydrogen sulfide, or helium.

Replace.Text: Coffee is a brewed beverage prepared from the roasted seeds of several species of evergreen shrub belonging to the genus Coffea. The earliest credible evidence of either coffee drinking or knowledge of the coffee tree appears in the middle of the 15th century, in the monasteries of Arabia. It was there that coffee seeds were first roasted and brewed, in a similar way to how it is prepared today. Eventually, through trade, coffee spread to Venetian ports in Italy, and from there, it was introduced to the rest of Europe.

Tea is an aromatic beverage commonly prepared by pouring hot water over cured leaves of the tea plant. Tea drinking likely began in China, during the Shang Dynasty, when it was initially used for medicinal purposes and combined with other herbs. It was first introduced to Portuguese priests and merchants in China during the 16th century, and later became popular in Britain during the 17th century, which eventually led to Britain competing with China's monopoly over it.

Tobacco is a product processed from the dried leaves of plants in the genus Nicotiana. It is used recreationally in cigars and cigarettes, snuff, pipe tobacco, chewing tobacco and flavored shisha. Many Native American tribes have traditionally gReplacen and used tobacco, with some cultivation sites in Mexico dating back to 1400-1000 B.C. Eastern North American tribes carried large amounts of tobacco in pouches as a readily accepted trade item, and often smoked it in peace pipes, either in defined sacred ceremonies or to seal a bargain. Following the arrival of the Europeans, tobacco became increasingly popular as a trade item and grew into its own industry.

Amber is fossilized tree resin, which has been appreciated for its color and natural beauty since Neolithic times. Much valued from antiquity to the present as a gemstone, amber is made into a variety of decorative objects. Amber is used as an ingredient in perfumes, as a healing agent in folk medicine, and as jewelry. Because it originates as a soft, sticky tree resin, amber sometimes contains animal and plant material as inclusions.

Jade is an ornamental stone and is the name given to two types of metamorphic rock, nephrite and jadeite. Among the earliest known jade artifacts excavated from prehistoric sites are simple ornaments with bead, button, and tubular shapes. Additionally, jade was used for adze heads, knives, and other weapons, which can be delicately shaped. As metal-working technologies became available, the beauty of jade made it valuable for ornaments and decorative objects. In Chinese history, Jade was considered the "imperial gem" and had a status-value exceeding that of gold or silver.

The olive is a species of small tree in the family Oleaceae, native to the coastal areas of the eastern Mediterranean Basin as well as northern Iraq, and northern Iran at the south of the Caspian Sea. Its fruit, also called the olive, is of major agricultural importance in the Mediterranean region as the source of olive oil. The olive has been the symbol of peace, wisdom, glory, fertility, power and purity. Olive oil has long been considered sacred, and even today, it is still used in many religious ceremonies. Over the years, the olive has been the symbol of peace, wisdom, glory, fertility, power and purity.

Perfumes have been known to exist in some of the earliest human civilizations. Perfumery, or the art of making perfumes, began in ancient Mesopotamia and Egypt and was further refined by the Romans and Persians. The production technique of rose perfumes originated in Persia then spread through Arabia and India, and more recently into Eastern Europe. Rose oil is the essential oil extracted from the petals of various types of roses. Due to the labor-intensive production process and the low content of oil in the rose blooms, rose oil commands a very high price. Even so, it is still perhaps the most widely used essential oil in perfumery.

Coral is a branching skeleton-like structure built by small marine animals known as polyps. Red coral, also known as precious coral, is one of the most ancient of gems and has been harvested since antiquity for decorative use. It belongs to a small class of organic gemstones, which are not really stones at all, that include materials such as pearl, amber, ivory, and jet. Historically, precious coral was not only a highly prized form of ornamentation, but it was also a substance believed to be endowed with mysterious sacred properties. Along with being used as a charm, it also had many medicinal virtues attributed to it. Today, laws and organizations help protect coral reefs since their populations are threatened by overharvesting, overfishing, and climate change.

Lapis lazuli is a deep blue semi-precious stone that has been prized since antiquity for its intense color. It has been mined for over 6,000 years in Afghanistan and was the source of lapis for ancient Egyptian and Mesopotamian civilizations, as well as the later Greeks and Romans. In addition to the Afghan deposits, lapis lazuli can be found in other parts of the world, such as Russia, Chile, Canada, India, Italy, and the USA. Lapis lazuli takes an excellent polish and was valued for making into jewelry, carvings, vases, and other ornaments; especially in ancient Egypt. It was also ground and processed to make the most highly sought after pigment, ultramarine, which was worth more than gold. During the Renaissance, this valuable pigment was used sparingly and often reserved to color the robes of Mary and other important religious figures.

Glass has been used for centuries in windows and drinking vessels. Archaeological evidence suggests the first man made glass was in Eastern Mesopotamia and Egypt around 3500 BC and the first glass vessels were made there around 1500 BC. Syrian craftsmen invented the blow pipe in the 1st century BC, which made glass production easier, faster, and cheaper. Glass production flourished in the Roman Empire and spread from Italy to all countries under its rule. Venice was famous for its ornate glass-work, known as Venetian glass, and was the glassmaking center of the western world. Toward the end of the 13th century, the center of the Venetian glass industry moved to Murano. Some of the most important brands of glass in the world today are still produced in the historical glass factories within Murano.
Glass is only available through a Mercantile City-State.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tradition[ENDCOLOR] is best for "tall" empires. A prefecture (from the Latin Praefectura) is an administrative jurisdiction or subdivision in any of various countries and within some international church structures, and in antiquity a Roman district governed by an appointed prefect.
Imperial Examination

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Imperial Examination[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in the city. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Add a Scientist Slot in each City.

The imperial examination was a civil service examination system in Imperial China to select candidates for the state bureaucracy. Although there were imperial exams as early as the Han dynasty, the system became the major path to office only in the mid-Tang dynasty, and remained so until its abolition in 1905. Since the exams were based on knowledge of the classics and literary style, not technical expertise, successful candidates were generalists who shared a common language and culture, one shared even by those who failed.
Centralisation
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Centralisation[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]New Units receive +15 XP. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][ICON_PIRATE] Population Loss from Unit Casualties reduced by 33%.

Centralisation, or centralization (see spelling differences), is theprocess by which the activities of an organisation, particularly those regarding planning and decision-making, become concentrated within a particular location and/or group or keeping all of the important decisionmaking powers within head office or the centre of the organisation.

A bill of rights, sometimes called a declaration of rights, is a list of the most important rights to the citizens of a country. The purpose of these bills is to protect those rights against infringement.
Province

A province is a territorial unit, almost always an administrative division, within a country or state.
Decentralization
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Decentralization[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in Cities. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Garrisoned units cost no maintenance.

Decentralization (or decentralisation) is the process of redistributing or dispersing functions, powers, people or things away from a central location or authority. While decentralization, especially in the governmental sphere, is widely studied and practiced, there is no common definition or understanding of decentralization. The meaning of decentralization may vary in part because of the different ways it is applied.

Row.Text: Dependent Origination

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Dependent Origination[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]20% of the total [ICON_PEACE] Faith output each turn added to the amount of Global [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness. (At least +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, no upper limit)

Pratītyasamutpāda (Sanskrit: प्रतीत्यसमुत्पाद; Pali: पटिच्चसमुप्पाद paṭiccasamuppāda), commonly translated as dependent origination, or dependent arising, states that all dharmas ("things") arise in dependence upon other dharmas: "if this exists, that exists; if this ceases to exist, that also ceases to exist." It is a pragmatic teaching, which is applied to dukkha (suffering) and the cessation of dukkha.

In international politics, gunboat diplomacy (or "big stick diplomacy" in U.S. history) refers to the pursuit of foreign policy objectives with the aid of conspicuous displays of naval power—implying or constituting a direct threat of warfare, should terms not be agreeable to the superior force.

Military aid is aid which is used to assist a country or it's people in its defense efforts, or to assist a poor country in maintaining control over its own territory. Many countries receive military aid to help with counter-insurgency efforts. Military aid can also be given to a rebellion to help fight another country.

Consumerism is a social and economic order and ideology that encourages the acquisition of goods and services in ever-greater amounts. Early criticisms of consumerism are present in the works of Thorstein Veblen (1899). Veblen's subject of examination, the newly emergent middle class arising at the turn of the twentieth century,comes to fruition by the end of the twentieth century through the process of globalization. In this sense, consumerism is usually considered a part of media culture.

The term thalassocracy (from Greek language θάλασσα (thalassa), meaning "sea", and κρατεῖν (kratein), meaning "to rule", giving θαλασσοκρατία (thalassokratia), "rule of the sea") refers to a state with primarily maritime realms—an empire at sea, such as the Phoenician network of merchant cities. Traditional thalassocracies seldom dominate interiors, even in their home territories (for example: Phoenician Tyre, Sidon and Carthage or Srivijaya and Majapahit in Southeast Asia).

Not like the brazen giant of Greek fame, with conquering limbs astride from land to land; Here at our sea-washed, sunset gates shall stand a mighty woman with a torch whose flame is imprisoned lightning, and her name Mother of Exiles. From her beacon-hand glows world-wide welcome; her mild eyes command the air-bridged harbor that twin cities. "Keep ancient lands your storied pomp!" cries she with silent lips. "Give me your tired your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, the wretched refuse of your teeming shore. Send these, the homeless, tempest-tossed to me, I lift my lamp beside the golden door!"

Free trade is a policy in international markets in which governments do not restrict imports or exports. Free trade is exemplified by the European Union / European Economic Area and the North American Free Trade Agreement, which have established open markets.

A planned economy is the economic system in which decisions regarding production and investment are embodied in a plan formulated by a central authority, usually by a public body such as a government agency.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Collectivization[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Local Happiness from each Mechanized Farm and Grain Depot.

Collectivization in the Soviet Union was enforced under Stalin between 1928 and 1940. The goal of this policy was to consolidate individual land and labour into collective farms: mainly kolkhozy and sovkhozy. The Soviet leadership was confident that the replacement of individual peasant farms by collective ones would immediately increase the food supply for urban population, the supply of raw materials for processing industry, and agricultural exports. Collectivization was thus regarded as the solution to the crisis of agricultural distribution (mainly in grain deliveries) that had developed since 1927. This problem became more acute as the Soviet Union pressed ahead with its ambitious industrialization program.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hero of the People[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]The rate at which [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People are born is increased by 25% and the empire immediately enters a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Patriotic War[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength Bonus for all Land and Naval units when fighting in friendly territory. +15% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength of Cities.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Young Pioneers[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Local Happiness from each [COLOR_WATER_TEXT]Power Plant Buildings[ENDCOLOR] (Except Power Plant Additional Units). [NEWLINE]-33%[ICON_GOLD]Maintenance of these buildings.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceflight Pioneers[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]May finish Spaceship parts with Great Engineers. Each Scientist +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, Engineer +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science. A Great Scientist appear outside the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Workers' Faculties[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output from each Factory.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Resettlement[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Settler equals 3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population (New city start with 3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population or add 3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population when joining the existing city). -100% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from Setter
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Scientific Socialism[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]+50% Tourism [ICON_TOURISM] to other Ideology Civilizations, +25% Tourism [ICON_TOURISM] to other Order civilizations.

Scientific socialism is the term used by Friedrich Engels[1] to describe the social-political-economic theory first pioneered by Karl Marx. The purported reason why this socialism is "scientific socialism" (as opposed to "utopian socialism") is because its theories are held to an empirical standard, observations are essential to its development, and these can result in changes and/or falsification of elements of the theory.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Down to the Countryside Movement[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for every Mine, Lumber Mill, Farm, Polder, Terrace Farm, Pasture and Trading Post.

The Up to the Mountains and Down to the Countryside Movement was a policy instituted in the People's Republic of China in the late 1960s and early 1970s. As a result of the anti-bourgeois thinking prevalent during the Cultural Revolution, Mao Zedong declared certain privileged urban youth would be sent to mountainous areas or farming villages in order to learn from the workers and farmers there.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Five-Year Plan[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for every Mine, Quarry, Lumber Mill, Oil Well, Offshore Platform and Workboats.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Dictatorship of the Proletariat[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]-1 Level for all Lv2 - Lv5 cities. (NOT stack with the Trait Effect of England) All previous [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Anti-corruption and Public Security Buildings[ENDCOLOR] will also change automatically.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Internationalism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]-50% [ICON_TEAM_2] International Immigration Rate from Your Nation to other civlizations. +33% [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Puppet[ENDCOLOR] cities. Counteract the [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from Public Opinion in your Civilization, and double [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] public opinion pressure for other ideological civilizations.

Internationalism is a political principle that advocates greater political or economic cooperation among states and nations. It is associated with other political movements and ideologies, but can also reflect a doctrine, belief system, or movement in itself. [NEWLINE]Supporters of internationalism are known as internationalists and generally believe that humans should unite across national, political, cultural, racial, or class boundaries to advance their common interests, or that governments should cooperate because their mutual long-term interests are of greater importance than their short-term disputes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]—— "C’est la lutte finale Groupons nous et demain L’Internationale Sera le genre humain!"
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Futurism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]When you capture a city, receive 20 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture as a plunder for each point of Culture produced in the captured city.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]United Front[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from every Military Base, Military Academy and Dojo. [NEWLINE]The military buildings in city with military base keep existing even you sell the local government.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fortified Borders[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Local Happiness from every Military building and Resource building. [NEWLINE]-50% [ICON_GOLD]Maintenance of these Buildings and +100%[ICON_PRODUCTION] while building these buildings.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]War Propaganda[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]-50% [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance Time for newly captured cities. The city will NOT resist if its [ICON_CITIZEN] Population is less than 6 after capturing or the old owner has loss its original capital city.

Propaganda is a powerful weapon in war; it is used to dehumanize and create hatred toward a supposed enemy, either internal or external, by creating a false image in the mind. This can be done by using derogatory or racist terms, avoiding some words or by making allegations of enemy atrocities. Most propaganda wars require the home population to feel the enemy has inflicted an injustice, which may be fictitious or may be based on facts. The home population must also decide that the cause of their nation is just.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Lightning Warfare[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for Great Generals. +1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for All Land Non-militia Units. The use of roads in enemy territory is permitted.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Total War[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower for each city. -1 Level [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods and [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity cost of City Size before the city growing up to Large. Military unit training speed +25%.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Police State[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Local Happiness from every Courthouse, Constabulary, Sheriff Office, Police Station and Procuratorate. +200% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when constructing these buildings.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cult of Personality[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE] -15% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in non-occupied Cities and the empire immediately enters a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age.[NEWLINE]Negates the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism bonus from other players' technologies (from Printing Press to Internet). Half the [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from Public Opinion.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Authoritarianism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+4 attack demage for each occupied original capital city.
Authoritarianism is a form of government characterized by absolute or blind obedience to authority, as against individual freedom and related to the expectation of unquestioning obedience.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hegemonism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]When you build a Strategic Weapon, create [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism to all known civs. Naval Battaleships, Carriers, Strategic Bomber,: 50% of its [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength; Nuclear Weapons:250,500,1000.

Hegemony is the political, economic, or military predominance or control of one state over others. In ancient Greece (8th century BC – 6th century AD), hegemony denoted the politico-military dominance of a city-state over other city-states. The dominant state is known as the hegemon. In the 19th century, hegemony came to denote the "Social or cultural predominance or ascendancy; predominance by one group within a society or milieu". Later, it could be used to mean "a group or regime which exerts undue influence within a society". Also, it could be used for the geopolitical and the cultural predominance of one country over others, from which was derived hegemonism, as in the idea that the Great Powers meant to establish European hegemony over Africa, Asia and Latin America.

Row.Text: Equals 3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
+1[ICON_MOVES] Movement.
+1[ICON_MOVES] Movement
Can move across Mountains or Ice

Replace.Text: [ICON_BULLET]+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for Land and Naval Melee Units when have another military Unit in an adjacent tile. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Flank Attack bonus +50%.

Row.Text: Sharp Shooter
[ICON_BULLET]+15% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength when attacking enemy units and being Ranged Striked by enemy.
[ICON_GREAT_WRITER] Theocracy
[ICON_RESEARCH] Imperial Academy
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
[ICON_ARROW_LEFT][ICON_CULTURE]
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture that the civilization that established the trade route generates from this trade route.
[ICON_ARROW_RIGHT][ICON_CULTURE]
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture that the destination civilization would receive from this trade route.
Authoritarianism
Negates the Tourism bonus from other players' technologies.

Replace.Text: Allows your cities to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Satellite Units[ENDCOLOR], which offer global bonus to all nations. [NEWLINE]It also unlocks the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Starship Project[ENDCOLOR] for achieving a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Science victory[ENDCOLOR].

In SuperPower Mod, the journey to the space is more detailed. The Apollo program is only the first step of the space travelling. To build spaceship parts, you must finish the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Starship Project[ENDCOLOR], unlock by the Apollo program, in the future era.

Row.Text: Starship Project
Allows the building of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Parts[ENDCOLOR] for achieving a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Science victory[ENDCOLOR].

A starship, starcraft or interstellar spacecraft is a theoretical spacecraft designed for traveling between planetary systems, as opposed to a vehicle designed for orbital spaceflight or interplanetary travel.
Spartiates Training Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to purchase the elite infantry unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Spartiates[ENDCOLOR].

The Spartiates (Greek: Σπαρτιάται, "Spartans") or Homoioi (Greek: Ὅμοιοι, "those who are alike"; sing. homoios) were the males of Sparta known to the Spartans as "peers" or "men of equal status". From a young age, male Spartiates were trained for battle and put through gruelling challenges intended to craft them into fearless warriors. In battle, they had the reputation of being the best soldiers in Greece, and the strength of Sparta's hoplite forces let the city become the dominant state in Greece throughout much of the Classical period.
Numidian Cavalry Training Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to purchase the elite infantry unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Numidian Cavalry[ENDCOLOR].

The Numidians were the Berber people who lived in Numidia (present day Algeria) and in a smaller part of Tunisia. The Numidians were one of the earliest natives to trade with the settlers of Carthage. As Carthage grew, the relationship with the Numidians blossomed. Carthage's military used the Numidian cavalry as mercenaries.
Elite Rider Training Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to purchase the elite cavalry unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Dark Armored Rider[ENDCOLOR].

The Dark Armored Rider were a Chinese elite heavy cavalry troops. They served as the Emperor Taizong of Tang's guards. This troop is made up of elite knights wearing dark steel armor. With their distinction in the war, they were always considered as on of the most powerful cavalry troops of the 7th centry.
Landsknecht Mercenary Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to purchase the elite mercenary unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Landsknecht[ENDCOLOR].

The landsknecht were German mercenary pikemen of the 16th century. Created in imitation of the legendary Swiss mercenary pikemen, the landsknecht would eventually supplant them as the best mercenary infantry available in Europe, fighting in almost every major engagement in the 16th century - often on both sides.
Longbowman Training Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the elite archery unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Longbowman[ENDCOLOR].

It was the difficulty in using the longbow that led various monarchs of England to issue instructions encouraging their ownership and practice, including the Assize of Arms of 1252 and King Edward III's declaration of 1363: "Whereas the people of our realm, rich and poor alike, were accustomed formerly in their games to practise archery – whence by God's help, it is well known that high honour and profit came to our realm, and no small advantage to ourselves in our warlike enterprises...
Treasure Voyages Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the treasure voyages fleet: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Zheng He's Fleet[ENDCOLOR].

In Chinese history, the treasure voyages were the seven Ming-era maritime voyages of the treasure fleet between 1405 and 1433. The Yongle Emperor initiated the construction of the treasure fleet in 1403. The grand project resulted in seven far-reaching ocean voyages to the coastal territories and islands in and around the South China Sea, the Indian Ocean, and beyond. Admiral Zheng He was commissioned to command the treasure fleet for the expeditions. Six of the voyages occurred during the Yongle reign (r. 1402–24), while the seventh voyage occurred under the Xuande reign (r. 1425–1435). The first three voyages reached up to Calicut on India's southwestern coast, while the fourth voyage went as far as Hormuz in the Persian Gulf. Afterwards, the fleet made voyages farther away to the Arabian Peninsula and East Africa.
Early Multiple Rocket Launcher Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype multiple rocket launcher: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Hwacha[ENDCOLOR].

ong before the development of the hwachas, China imposed severe restrictions on exporting gunpowder to Joseon Korea, fiercely guarding a military asset. Yet gunpowder weapons were key to the Koreans in maintaining a predominant navy in the Sea of Japan (East Sea) to protect fishermen and merchants against the increasing numbers of invading Japanese and Wokou pirates. In response, there was an effort by Koreans to develop gunpowder on their own. Korea first began production of gunpowder during the period 1374–76. In 1377 a Korean scholar named Choe Mu-seon discovered a way to obtain it by extracting potassium nitrate from the soil and subsequently invented the juhwa, Korea's very first rocket.Further developments led to the birth of the family of singijeons. The hwacha was a further development from the juhwa and the singijeon. The first hwacha was developed in Korea in 1409 during the Joseon Dynasty.
Ski Infantry Training Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to train the elite infantry unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Ski Infantry[ENDCOLOR].
Ski warfare, the use of ski-equipped troops in war, is first recorded by the Danish historian Saxo Grammaticus in the 13th century.
Prototype Submarine Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to train the Experimental Unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]The Nautilus[ENDCOLOR].

The Nautilus is the fictional submarine captained by Nemo featured in Jules Verne's novels Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea (1870) and The Mysterious Island (1874). Verne named the Nautilus after Robert Fulton's real-life submarine Nautilus (1800). Three years before writing his novel, Jules Verne also studied a model of the newly developed French Navy submarine Plongeur at the 1867 Exposition Universelle, which inspired him for his definition of the Nautilus.
Land Ironclad Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the pre-tank unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Land Ironclad[ENDCOLOR].

"The Land Ironclads" is a short story by H.G. Wells that originally appeared in the December 1903 issue of the Strand Magazine. It features "land ironclads," 100-foot-long (30 m) machines that are equipped with remote-controlled guns and that carry riflemen, engineers, and a captain.
Super Howitzer Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the super howitzer unit: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Big Bertha[ENDCOLOR].

Big Bertha (German: Dicke Bertha)—literal translation "Fat or heavy Bertha"—is the name of a type of super-heavy mortar developed by the armaments manufacturer Krupp in Germany on the eve of World War I. Its official designation was the L/12, i.e., the barrel was 12 calibre in length, 42-cm (16.5 inch) Type M-Gerät 14 (M-Equipment 1914) Kurze Marine-Kanone ("short naval gun", a name intended to camouflage the weapon's real purpose).
Airship Carrier Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the airship carrier unit: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Zeppelin[ENDCOLOR].

Big Bertha (German: Dicke Bertha)—literal translation "Fat or heavy Bertha"—is the name of a type of super-heavy mortar developed by the armaments manufacturer Krupp in Germany on the eve of World War I. Its official designation was the L/12, i.e., the barrel was 12 calibre in length, 42-cm (16.5 inch) Type M-Gerät 14 (M-Equipment 1914) Kurze Marine-Kanone ("short naval gun", a name intended to camouflage the weapon's real purpose).
Elite Sniper Training Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the elite sniper unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Elite Sniper[ENDCOLOR].

A sniper is a trained marksman who operates alone, in a pair, or with a sniper team to maintain close visual contact with a target and engage the targets from concealed positions or distances exceeding the detection capabilities of enemy personnel.
Heavy Armored Battle Ship Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the super battleship unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Bismarck[ENDCOLOR].
The Bismarck class was a pair of battleships built for Nazi Germany's Kriegsmarine shortly before the outbreak of World War II. The ships were the largest warships built for the Kriegsmarine.
The Grey Ghost Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project has the chance to generate the Heroic Carrier unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Enterprise(CV-6)[ENDCOLOR].

USS Enterprise (CV-6) was the seventh U.S. Navy vessel to bear the name. Colloquially called "the Big E". A Yorktown-class carrier, she was launched in 1936 and was one of only three American carriers commissioned before World War II to survive the war. She participated in more major actions of the war against Japan than any other United States ship. These actions included the Attack on Pearl Harbor, the Battle of Midway, the Battle of the Eastern Solomons, the Battle of the Santa Cruz Islands, various other air-sea engagements during the Guadalcanal Campaign, the Battle of the Philippine Sea, and the Battle of Leyte Gulf. Enterprise earned 20 battle stars, the most for any U.S. warship in World War II, and was the most decorated U.S. ship of World War II. On three occasions during the Pacific War, the Japanese announced that she had been sunk in battle, inspiring her nickname "The Grey Ghost".
Project Habu
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the strategic reconnaissance aircraft unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]SR-71 "Blackbird"[ENDCOLOR].

Lockheed's previous reconnaissance aircraft was the relatively slow U-2, designed for the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA). In late 1957, the CIA approached the defense contractor Lockheed to build an undetectable spy plane. While deployed in Okinawa, the SR-71s and their aircrew members gained the nickname Habu (as did the A-12s preceding them) after a pit viper indigenous to Japan, which the Okinawans thought the plane resembled.
Super-heavy Tank Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the super-heavy tank unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Panzer VIII Maus[ENDCOLOR].

Super-heavy tanks are armoured fighting vehicles of very large size, generally over 75 tonnes[citation needed]. Programs have been initiated on several occasions with the aim of creating an invincible vehicle for penetrating enemy formations without fear of being destroyed in combat; however, only a few examples have ever been built, and there is no clear evidence any of these vehicles saw combat. Examples were designed in World War I and World War II, along with a few in the Cold War.
Trutnev-Babaev Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the King of Bombs: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]The Tsar Bomba[ENDCOLOR].
The Tsar Bomba was a three-stage bomb with Trutnev-Babaev[6] second and third stage design,[7] with a yield of 50 megatons.
Nuclear Artillery Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype Nuclear Artillery Weapon: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Kondensator[ENDCOLOR].

The development of nuclear artillery was part of a broad push by nuclear weapons countries to develop nuclear weapons which could be used tactically against enemy armies in the field (as opposed to strategic uses against cities, military bases, and heavy industry).
Tactical Nuclear Recoilless Gun Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype Tactical Nuclear Weapon: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Nuclear Rocket Launcher[ENDCOLOR].

A tactical nuclear weapon (or TNW) also known as non-strategic nuclear weapon refers to a nuclear weapon which is designed to be used on a battlefield in military situations, mostly with friendly forces in proximity and perhaps even on contested friendly territory.
Elite Militia Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to purchase the elite militia unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Cossack Militia[ENDCOLOR].

Cossack society and government were heavily militarized. The nation was called a host (vois’ko, or viys’ko, translated as 'army'). The people and territories were subdivided into regimental and company districts, and village posts (polky, sotni, and stanytsi). A unit of a Cossack troop could be called a kuren.
Super Battleship Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the super battleship unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Yamato[ENDCOLOR].

Super battleship is an unofficial classification of battleships encompassing the largest types constructed or planned, displacing roughly 60,000 tons or more. Only two such battleships were ever constructed, though many more were planned by several navies of the world before and during the Second World War. Their design emphasized thick armor and big-caliber guns, the most ideal warships for the decisive battle doctrine between battleships, which then had large support. However the advent of the aircraft carriers compromised their use, and the only two ever built (both by the Japanese Empire) were both sunk during World War II.
Prototype Stealth Bomber Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype stealth bomber unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Horten Ho 229[ENDCOLOR].

In the closing weeks of World War 2, the US military initiated "Operation Paperclip", an effort by the US Army to capture as much advanced German weapons research as possible, and also to deny that research to advancing Soviet troops. A Horten glider and the nearly complete Ho 229 V3 third prototype airframe were secured and sent to Northrop Aviation for evaluation in the United States,[3] who much later used a flying wing design for the B-2 stealth bomber.
Prototype Underwater Carrier Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype underwater carrier unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Hydra[ENDCOLOR].

A submarine aircraft carrier is a submarine equipped with aircraft for observation or attack missions. These submarines saw their most extensive use during World War II, although their operational significance remained rather small. The most famous of them were the Japanese I-400 class submarine and the French submarine Surcouf, although small numbers of similar craft were built for other nations' navies as well.
Next-generation Self-propelled Howitzer Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype mobile artillery unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]XM2001 Crusader[ENDCOLOR].

The XM2001 Crusader was to be the United States Army's next-generation self-propelled howitzer (SPH), designed to improve the survivability, lethality, mobility, and effectiveness of the artillery as well as the overall force. It was initially scheduled for fielding by 2008. United Defense was the prime contractor; General Dynamics the major subcontractor. In early May 2002, Secretary of Defense Donald Rumsfeld cancelled the $11 billion USD program because he considered it neither mobile nor precise enough.
Task Force 141 Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the elite special forces unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Task Force 141[ENDCOLOR].

Task Force 141, colloquially referred to as "The One-Four-One," is a multinational special operations force composed of members of British, Australian, American, Canadian and possibly other foreign personnel, usually those with previous Special Ops experience.
Anti-ship MLRS Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype Anti-ship MLRS unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Weishi Rockets[ENDCOLOR].

The Weishi (WS; Chinese: 卫士; literally: "Guardian") family of the multiple rocket launcher systems were mainly developed by Sichuan Aerospace Industry Corporation (SCAIC, also known as Base 062) in Chengdu, Sichuan Province. The Weishi series rocket systems include the 302mm WS-1 (100 km range), the improved 302mm WS-1B (180 km range), the 122mm WS-1E (40 km), the 400mm WS-2 (200 km range), as well as many other models. The WS-1 series weapon system did not enter PLA service and has order from Thailand. The WS-2 may finally see PLA service in the future. It's worth noticing that although sharing the same name, there are other developers for different models of Weishi series multiple rocket launchers (MRL) other than the primary developer SCAIC.
PAK FA Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype stealth multirole fighter unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]PAK FA T-50[ENDCOLOR].

The PAK FA ( Perspektivny Aviatsionny Kompleks Frontovoy Aviatsii, literally "Prospective Airborne Complex of Frontline Aviation") is a fifth-generation fighter programme of the Russian Air Force. The T-50 is the aircraft designed by Sukhoi for the PAK FA programme.
Light Helicopter Experimental Program
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype stealth helicopter unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]RAH-66 Comanche[ENDCOLOR].

During the early 1980s, the U.S. Army began formulating a requirement for the replacement of its helicopters then in service, resulting in the Light Helicopter Experimental program. In 1991, the Boeing-Sikorsky team was chosen to produce prototypes. The Comanche would incorporate stealth technologies, featuring a number of designs previously untried. It was to employ advanced sensors in its reconnaissance role, and was intended to designate targets for the AH-64 Apache. The aircraft was also armed with missiles and rockets to destroy armored vehicles. Two RAH-66 prototypes were built and conducted flight testing from 1996 to 2004. Since the cancellation the prototypes have been placed on display.
Prototype Mecha Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype mecha unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Giant Death Robot[ENDCOLOR].

Mecha is a science fiction genre that centers on robots or machines controlled by people. These machines vary greatly in size, shape, and appearance. Some are little more than cars with arms and legs, while others are giant humanoid constructs. Different sub-genres exist, with varying connotations of realism. The concept of Super Robot and Real Robot are two such examples found in Japanese anime.
Bit Weapon Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype cyber war weapon: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Bit Weapon[ENDCOLOR].

In computer security, a hacker is someone who focuses on security mechanisms of computer and network systems. While including those who endeavor to strengthen such mechanisms, it is more often used by the mass media and popular culture to refer to those who seek access despite these security measures.
Particle Weapon Development Project
Only the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]First[ENDCOLOR] civilization finishing this project is allowed to build the prototype particle weapon unit: [COLOR_YIELD_GOLD]Particle Cannon Vessel[ENDCOLOR].

A particle-beam weapon uses a high-energy beam of atomic or subatomic particles to damage the target by disrupting its atomic and/or molecular structure. A particle-beam weapon is a type of directed-energy weapon, which directs energy in a particular and focused direction using particles with negligible mass.
Naval Exploration Project
Allows you to build all [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Naval Unit[ENDCOLOR] able enter the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Deep Ocean[ENDCOLOR].

The Age of Discovery is a historical period of European global exploration that started in the early 15th century with the first Portuguese discoveries in the Atlantic archipelagos and Africa, as well as the discovery of America by Spain in 1492, and the discovery of the ocean route to the East in 1498, and by a series of European naval expeditions across the Atlantic and later the Pacific, which continued until the 18th century. It is sometimes regarded as a bridge between the Middle Ages and the Modern era, along with its contemporary Renaissance movement. European overseas expansion led to the rise of colonial empires, with the contact between the Old and New Worlds producing the Columbian Exchange: a wide transfer of plants, animals, foods, human populations (including slaves), communicable diseases and culture between the Eastern and Western hemispheres.

Knights Templar

The Poor Fellow-Soldiers of Christ and of the Temple of Solomon (Latin: Pauperes commilitones Christi Templique Salomonici), commonly known as the Knights Templar, the Order of the Temple (French: Ordre du Temple or Templiers) or simply as Templars, were among the most wealthy and powerful of the Western Christian military orders and were among the most prominent actors of the Christian finance.

After researching Automation. All pillaged improvements will be repaired and unimproved resources can be improved at any time when you use a worker to do "Automation".
