Researching this new technology will unlock new buildings, wonders, units and elite units. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tile Improvement[ENDCOLOR] construction speed increased by 25%.
Fishery

Generally, a fishery is an entity engaged in raising or harvesting fish which is determined by some authority to be a fishery. According to the FAO, a fishery is typically defined in terms of the "people involved, species or type of fish, area of water or seabed, method of fishing, class of boats, purpose of the activities or a combination of the foregoing features". The definition often includes a combination of fish and fishers in a region, the latter fishing for similar species with similar gear types.
"Many men go fishing all of their lives without knowing that it is not fish they are after." [NEWLINE] - Henry David Thoreau
Hunting

Hunting has a long history and may well pre-date the rise of the species Homo sapiens. While our earliest Hominid ancestors were probably frugivores or omnivores, there is evidence that earlier Homo species,[3][4] and possibly also australopithecine[5] species, utilised larger animals for subsistence. Evidence from western Kenya suggests that hunting may have occurred as long ago as two million years.[6]
"There is no hunting like the hunting of man, and those who have hunted armed men long enough and liked it, never care for anything else thereafter." [NEWLINE] - Ernest Hemingway
Aesthetics
Aesthetics (also spelled æsthetics) is a branch of philosophy dealing with the nature of art, beauty, and taste, with the creation and appreciation of beauty.
"Beauty is how you feel inside, and it reflects in your eyes. It is not something physical." [NEWLINE] ― Sophia Loren
Administration
Management in businesses and organizations is the function that coordinates the efforts of people to accomplish goals and objectives by using available resources efficiently and effectively.
"When one with honeyed words but evil mind. Persuades the mob, great woes befall the state." [NEWLINE] ― Euripides, Orestes
Marine Engineering

Marine engineering often refers to the engineering of boats, ships, oil rigs and any other marine vessel or structure, but also encompasses oceanographic engineering. Specifically, marine engineering is the discipline of applying engineering sciences, and can include mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, electronic engineering, and computer science, to the development, design, operation and maintenance of watercraft propulsion and also on-board systems and oceanographic technology, not limited to just power and propulsion plants, machinery, piping, automation and control systems etc. for marine vehicles of any kind like surface ships, submarines etc.
"Beware of little expenses. A small leak will sink a great ship." [NEWLINE] - Benjamin Franklin
Sonar

Sonar (originally an acronym for Sound Navigation And Ranging) is a technique that uses sound propagation (usually underwater, as in submarine navigation) to navigate, communicate with or detect objects on or under the surface of the water, such as other vessels.
"Dominate the enemy by striking first." [NEWLINE] - Ban Gu
Military Logistics

The word "logistics" is derived from the Greek adjective logistikos meaning "skilled in calculating". The first administrative use of the word was in Roman and Byzantine times when there was a military administrative official with the title Logista. At that time, the word apparently implied a skill involved in numerical computations.
"Gentlemen, the officer who doesn't know his communications and supply as well as his tactics is totally useless." [NEWLINE] - Gen. George S. Patton
Advanced Engineering

Aeronautical Engineering deals with aircraft design while Aerospace Engineering is a more modern term that expands the reach envelope of the discipline by including spacecraft design. Its origins can be traced back to the aviation pioneers around the turn of the century from the 19th century to the 20th although the work of Sir George Cayley has recently been dated as being from the last decade of the 18th century. Early knowledge of aeronautical engineering was largely empirical with some concepts and skills imported from other branches of engineering. Only a decade after the successful flights by the Wright brothers, the 1920s saw extensive development of aeronautical engineering through development of World War I military aircraft. Meanwhile, research to provide fundamental background science continued by combining theoretical physics with experiments.

Researching this new technology will unlock new buildings, wonders, units and elite units. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tile Improvement[ENDCOLOR] construction speed increased by 25%. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Allows [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Workers[ENDCOLOR] to move across the mountain or the ice.
"One man's magic is another man's engineering. Supernatural is a null word." [NEWLINE] ― Robert A. Heinlein
Large Calibre Artillery System

Large calibre artillery systems: Guns, howitzers, artillery pieces, combining the characteristics of a gun or a howitzer, mortars or multiple-launch rocket systems, capable of engaging surface targets by delivering primarily indirect fire, with a calibre of 100 millimetres and above.
"The artillery is a god of modern war." [NEWLINE] - Joseph Stalin
Urbanization
Urbanization is a population shift from rural to urban areas, "the gradual increase in the proportion of people living in urban areas", and the ways in which each society adapts to the change.
"Urbanization is the advent of edge species." [NEWLINE] - Kevin Kelly (1995) Out of Control: The New Biology of Machines, Social Systems and the Economic World
Mobilization

Mobilization is the act of assembling and making both troops and supplies ready for war. The word mobilization was first used, in a military context, in order to describe the preparation of the Russian army during the 1850s and 1860s. Mobilization theories and techniques have continuously changed since then. The opposite of mobilization is demobilization.
"I want you for U.S. Army" [NEWLINE] - J. M. Flagg's 1917 poster
Integrated Circuit

An integrated circuit or monolithic integrated circuit (also referred to as an IC, a chip, or a microchip) is a set of electronic circuits on one small plate ("chip") of semiconductor material, normally silicon.
"If the presence of electricity can be made visible in any part of the circuit, I see no reason why intelligence may not be transmitted instantaneously by electricity." [NEWLINE] - Samuel Morse
Composite Material

Composite materials (also called composition materials or shortened to composites) are materials made from two or more constituent materials with significantly different physical or chemical properties, that when combined, produce a material with characteristics different from the individual components.
"The whole is greater than the sum of its parts." [NEWLINE] - Aristotle
Advanced Flight

Little did the Wright Brothers know that less than four decades after their first plane touched down in the North Carolinian sand, aeronautical engineers would have already created a completely new way to power flight - the jet engine. The jet engine would find further application in the creation of the helicopter.
"Oh! I have slipped the surly bonds of Earth, put out my hand and touched the face of God! " [NEWLINE] - John Gillespie Magee
Electronic Surveillance
Surveillance is the monitoring of the behavior, activities, or other changing information, usually of people for the purpose of influencing, managing, directing, or protecting them.
"Know yourself and know your enemy, and you will never be defeated. " [NEWLINE] - Sunzi's Art of War
Artificial Intelligence

Artificial intelligence (AI) is the intelligence exhibited by machines or software, and the branch of computer science that develops machines and software with intelligence. Major AI researchers and textbooks define the field as "the study and design of intelligent agents",[1] where an intelligent agent is a system that perceives its environment and takes actions that maximize its chances of success.
"The appropriately programmed computer with the right inputs and outputs would thereby have a mind in exactly the same sense human beings have minds." [NEWLINE] - John Searle
Genetic Engineering

Genetic engineering, also called genetic modification, is the direct manipulation of an organism's genome using biotechnology. New DNA may be inserted in the host genome by first isolating and copying the genetic material of interest using molecular cloning methods to generate a DNA sequence, or by synthesizing the DNA, and then inserting this construct into the host organism.

"With genetic engineering, we will be able to increase the complexity of our DNA, and improve the human race. But it will be a slow process, because one will have to wait about 18 years to see the effect of changes to the genetic code." [NEWLINE] - Stephen Hawking
Automation

Automation or automatic control, is the use of various control systems for operating equipment such as machinery, processes in factories, boilers and heat treating ovens, switching in telephone networks, steering and stabilization of ships, aircraft and other applications with minimal or reduced human intervention. Some processes have been completely automated.

"The first rule of any technology used in a business is that automation applied to an efficient operation will magnify the efficiency. The second is that automation applied to an inefficient operation will magnify the inefficiency." [NEWLINE] - Bill Gates
Internet of Things

The Internet of Things (IoT) is the network of physical objects or "things" embedded with electronics, software, sensors, and network connectivity, which enables these objects to collect and exchange data. The Internet of Things allows objects to be sensed and controlled remotely across existing network infrastructure, creating opportunities for more direct integration between the physical world and computer-based systems, and resulting in improved efficiency, accuracy and economic benefit. Each thing is uniquely identifiable through its embedded computing system but is able to interoperate within the existing Internet infrastructure. Experts estimate that the IoT will consist of almost 50 billion objects by 2020.

"Without going outside his door, one understands all that takes place under the sky；without looking out from his window , one sees rules of the universe. The farther that one goes out from himself, the less he knows." [NEWLINE] - Lao-Tzu
BVR Combat

The term beyond-visual-range missile (BVR) usually refers to an air-to-air missile (BVRAAM) that is capable of engaging at ranges of 20 nmi (37 km) or beyond. This range has been achieved using dual pulse rocket motors or booster rocket motor and ramjet sustainer motor.
"In modern war... you will die like a dog for no good reason." [NEWLINE] - Ernest Hemingway
Superconductor

Superconductivity is a phenomenon of exactly zero electrical resistance and expulsion of magnetic fields occurring in certain materials when cooled below a characteristic critical temperature. It was discovered by Dutch physicist Heike Kamerlingh Onnes on April 8, 1911 in Leiden. Like ferromagnetism and atomic spectral lines, superconductivity is a quantum mechanical phenomenon.
"To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk." [NEWLINE] - Thomas Edison
Transhumanism

Transhumanism (abbreviated as H+ or h+) is an international and intellectual movement that tries to transform the human condition by developing and creating widely available technologies to greatly enhance human intellectual, physical, and psychological capacities.
"What use was time to those who'd soon achieve Digital Immortality?" [NEWLINE] - Clyde DeSouza, Memories With Maya
Space Technology

Space technology – technology developed by space science or the aerospace industry for use in spaceflight, satellites, or space exploration. Space technology includes spacecraft, satellites, space stations, and support infrastructure, equipment, and procedures. Space is such a novel environment that attempting to work in it requires new tools and techniques.
"The universe is so big, but compared with human ambition, it is so small." [NEWLINE] - Lincoln_lyf, the author of Superpower Mod of Sid Meier's Civilization V (2015)
Metamaterial

Metamaterials are materials engineered to have properties that have not yet been found in nature. They are made from assemblies of multiple elements fashioned from conventional materials such as metals or plastics. The materials are usually arranged in repeating patterns, often at microscopic or smaller scales that are smaller than the wavelengths of the phenomena they influence. Metamaterials derive their properties not from the properties of the base materials, but from their designed structure. Their precise shape, geometry, size, orientation and arrangement gives them their properties.
"Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit." [NEWLINE] - Bernard Williams
Photon Computer

Optical or photonic computing uses photons produced by lasers or diodes for computation. For decades, photons have promised to allow a higher bandwidth than the electrons used in conventional computers.
"Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower." [NEWLINE] - Steve Jobs
Interstellar Travel

Interstellar space travel is manned or unmanned travel between stars. The concept of interstellar travel via starships is a staple of science fiction. Interstellar travel is conceptually much more difficult than interplanetary travel.
"Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness." [NEWLINE] - Mark Twain
Intergrated Defense

The Strategic Defense Initiative (SDI) was proposed by U.S. President Ronald Reagan on March 23, 1983,[1] to use ground-based and space-based systems to protect the United States from attack by strategic nuclear ballistic missiles.
"War is Peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." [NEWLINE] - Nineteen Eighty-Four by George Orwell

Replace.Text: Artifact will be placed in nearest Great Work of Art slot. Artifact provides +4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism. Archaeologist will be consumed.
Ancient writing will be placed in nearest Great Work of Writing slot. Writing provides +4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism. Archaeologist will be consumed.

Row.Text: Break Ice

Clear the Ice on this tile to allow other naval units to pass (Unfortunately due to the limitation of the game, it will NOT change the terrian [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Graphic[ENDCOLOR] until reloading the game).

Replace.Text: Mountains are impassable, except to air units. They provide nothing to cities. However, after researching the Advanced Engineering, workers can quarry the mountain to transform the Mountain to a Hill and produce a Stone resource

Trading Posts are outposts where hunters and trappers may sell their wares to civilians in exchange for food, weapons, whiskey, gold, and all of the other trappings of society. They can generate a lot of wealth for a society. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_GOLD] Gold output and bonuses: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold output for the tile. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold output if constructed near the coast or by the river (can mutiply to +2 additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold). [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold output if constructed on the Road and +2 additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold output if constructed on the Railroad. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_CONSUMER] Consumer.

A Research Center is a special facility located outside the city where scientists perform advanced or even secret research. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] +8 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output for the tile. +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output if constructed near a mountain (can mutiply).

The Great Scientist can construct the special Research Center improvement which, when worked, produces lots of [ICON_RESEARCH] Science. Further, the Great Scientist lets you immediately learn any available technology. The Great Scientist is expended when used in any of both ways.

A railroad is a set of rails - usually metal - upon which a vehicle runs. The earliest railed vehicles were carts pulled by animal power; the first steam-powered locomotive appeared in England at the end of the 18th century. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]An unbroken chain of Railroads allows units to move extremely quickly through tiles (3 times faster than the road). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]After you researched the Railroad Technology, all Roads inside your territory will automatically upgrade to Railroads. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Railroad will NOT provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production bonus.

Row.Text: Fish Farming
In SuperPower Mod, the coast plot without any resources can also be improved by breeding a fish resource. It will provide additional [ICON_FOOD] Food output of the plot.
Create a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FISHERY_MOD]Fish Resurce[\LINK]

Breed a fish resource on costal tiles without resources. Then the worker will automatically build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fishing Net[ENDCOLOR] to improve it and increase the city's [ICON_FOOD] Food output. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May only be constructed in a coastal tile without resources . [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be constructed adjacent to another tile is currently under fish farming.
In the Super Power Mod, you are allowed to build improvements on water tiles without resource increase the city's [ICON_FOOD]food output!

Replace.Text: Workboats grant access to water-based luxury resources. Be aware that the "Worboats" is [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]DIFFERENT[ENDCOLOR] from "Fishing Boats" which grant access only to Fish Resources. Work Boats provide you with more Production and Gold bonus.

Row.Text: Fishing Net

Fishing Net grant access to Fish Resources (both natrual and man-made), improving the growth of nearby cities. Be aware that the "Fishing Net" is [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]DIFFERENT[ENDCOLOR] from "Workboats" which grant access to water-based luxury resources.
Construct a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FISHFARM_MOD]Fishing Net[\LINK]

Fishing Net grant access to Fish Resources (both natrual and man-made), to improve it and increase the city's [ICON_FOOD] Food output. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be constructed on a water-based luxury resource tile.
In the Super Power Mod, you are allowed to build improvements on water tiles without resource increase the city's [ICON_FOOD]Food output!
Natural Gas Drilling
In SuperPower Mod, the deep ocean without any resources can also be improved by digging out Natural Gas. It will provide additional [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output of the plot.
Drill a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GAS_RIG_MOD]Natural Gas Resource[\LINK]

Drill out a natural gas resource on ocean tiles without resources. Then the worker will automatically build an [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Offshore Platform[ENDCOLOR] to improve it and increase the city's [ICON_PRODUCTION]Production output. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on Ocean Tiles without resources. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be constructed adjacent to another tile is currently under natural gas drilling.
In the Super Power Mod, you are allowed to build improvements on ocean tiles without resource to drill the natural gas!
Pontoon Bridge

The Pontoon Bridge allows land units to cross a single coastal tile without embarking.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires at least two adjacent land tiles. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be constructed adjacent to another Pontoon Bridge.

A pontoon bridge or floating bridge or bridge of boats is a bridge that floats on water and in which barge- or boat-like pontoons support the bridge deck and its dynamic loads. While pontoon bridges are usually temporary structures, some are used for long periods of time. Permanent floating bridges are useful for sheltered water-crossings where it is not considered economically feasible to suspend a bridge from anchored piers. Such bridges can require a section that is elevated, or can be raised or removed, to allow ships to pass.
Construct a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_PONTOON_BRIDGE]Pontoon Bridge[\LINK]

Allows land units to cross a single coastal tile without embarking. May only be constructed in a coastal tile with 2 or more land tiles adjacent to it. May not be constructed adjacent to another Pontoon Bridge.
It will allow land units to cross the Coastal tile.

Replace.Text: The Naval Port allows any Naval Unit to enter the land tile where it is built. So it can be severed as a "canal" if built on the "Continental Bridge". May only be constructed on a Land Tile next to a Coast Tile. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Warning:[ENDCOLOR] The Naval Unit inside the Naval Port will be vulnerable to enemy's Land Units attack.
It will allow naval units to cross this land tile.

Can only be built on [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costal[ENDCOLOR] Land Tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Allows [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Naval Units[ENDCOLOR] to enter this Tile so they can use it as a canal to go through isthmus. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Offer [ICON_STRENGTH] Defensive Bonus to the Land Units in this tile. But the naval unit will be [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]vulnerable [ENDCOLOR] to enemy Land Units' attack.

Portuguese wine is the result of traditions introduced to the region by ancient civilizations, such as the Phoenicians, Carthaginians, Greeks, and mostly the Romans. Portugal started to export its wines to Rome during the Roman Empire. Modern exports developed with trade to England after the Methuen Treaty in 1703. From this commerce a wide variety of wines started to be grown in Portugal. And, in 1758, one of the first wine-producing region of the world, the Região Demarcada do Douro was created under the orientation of Marquis of Pombal, in the Douro Valley. Portugal has two wine producing regions protected by UNESCO as World Heritage: the Douro Valley Wine Region (Douro Vinhateiro) and Pico Island Wine Region (Ilha do Pico Vinhateira). Portugal has a big variety of local kinds, producing a very wide variety of different wines with distinctive personality.
It will increase the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold provided by this tile. Receive bonus output if built on a Riverside or Coastal Tile.
The Winery must be built adjacent to a luxury resource. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold if built on a Riverside or Coastal tile.
The Polder must be built on Flood Plain or Marsh.It provides +2[ICON_FOOD] Food and +2[ICON_PRODUCTION]Production.

The Terrace Farm can only be built on hills and does not need a source of fresh water to do so. Each adjacent mountain will provides +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output for the Terrace Farm.

Plant trees on this tile to create a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Forest[ENDCOLOR]. This action can only be performed on Plains, Grassland or Tundra tiles. [NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Warning:[ENDCOLOR] Any previous features or improvements will be removed.

Tipi
A Tipi can only be built on a Flat Terrain tile which has [ICON_RES_TRUFFLES][ICON_RES_FUR][ICON_RES_BISON][ICON_RES_DEER][ICON_RES_IVORY] resource or no resource.

The tipi (or teepee) is a portable, conical tent constructed of tanned hides and wooden poles traditionally associated with the migratory North American Plains Indians. The word itself comes from the Lakota for "they dwell." Often elaborately painted, tipis served to identify the separate tribes.
It will increase the amount of [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold provided by this tile.
Construct a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_SHOSHONE_TIPI]Tipi[\LINK]

Coffee/Cocoa Seedling

You can seed coffee on a to generate a [ICON_RES_COFFEE] Coffee Resource on a Flat Grassland tile, or a [ICON_RES_COCOA] Cocoa Resource on a Flat Plain tile. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on Flat Plains or Grasslands without resources. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be constructed adjacent to another tile is currently seeding coffee/cocoa. Coffee production in Ethiopia is a longstanding tradition. Ethiopia is where Coffea arabica, the coffee plant, originates. The plant is now grown in various parts of the world; Ethiopia itself accounts for around 3% of the global coffee market.
It will create a [ICON_RES_COFFEE] Coffee or [ICON_RES_COCOA] Cocoa Resource on the tile
Seeding [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_ETHIOPIA_COFFEE]Coffee/Cocoa[\LINK]
Byzantine Fort

Can be built on any tiles without resources. [NEWLINE]Provides +50% defense bonus for units fighting on the tile. [NEWLINE]Gain bonus yields (+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith) if built on Coastal Tiles. [NEWLINE]Gain a copy of luxury of the city state where it was built.

Angelokastro is a Byzantine castle on the island of Corfu, Greece. It is located at the top of the highest peak of the island's shoreline in the northwest coast near Palaiokastritsa and built on particularly precipitous and rocky terrain.
Construct a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_BYZANTIUM_ANGELOKASTRO]Byzantine Fort[\LINK]
Forest Farming
The Iroquoian people can build a farming inside a Forest without removing the forest. The output of forest would remain.
The Iroquois are a mix of horticulturalists, farmers, fishers, gatherers and hunters, though their main diet traditionally has come from farming.

Coastal Defense

A [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fixed Coastal Defense Unit[ENDCOLOR] is created after finishing building the . [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In the late game, the Coastal Defense can serve as an [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Airfield[ENDCOLOR] to deploy Land-based Aircraft and Nuclear Weapons. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Coastal Defense costs a certain amount of [ICON_GOLD] Maintenance Cost (but NO [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower Cost) accroding to its Fixed Coastal Defense Unit.

Coastal defence (or defense) and coastal fortification are measures taken to provide protection against military attack at or near a coastline (or other shoreline), for example, fortification and coastal artillery. Because an invading enemy normally requires a port or harbour to sustain operations, such defences are usually concentrated around such facilities, or places where such facilities could be constructed.
Construct a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COASTAL_FORT]Coastal Defense[\LINK]
Altar

Can only be built in Jungle or Forest. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be constructed adjacent to another Altar. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each adjacent Jungle will provides +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output for the Altar. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each Prophet in Altar provide +2 [ICON_RESEARCH][ICON_PEACE][ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Output.

An altar is any structure upon which offerings such as sacrifices and worship are made for religious purposes. Altars are usually found at shrines, and they can be located in temples, churches and other places of worship.
It will increase the amount of [ICON_RESEARCH] Science by this tile without removing the features.
Construct an [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MAYA_ALTAR]Altar[\LINK]

[ICON_BULLET]Can spend [ICON_GOLD] Gold to annex or puppet a City-State that has been your ally for 8 turns. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Each old Capital of City-State -2 Lv. at most of City Hall in its City (non-puppet).

[ICON_BULLET]+50% [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and [ICON_PEACE] Faith from friendly City-States. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Friendly Militaristic City-States offer units with free experience(20). [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+150 [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with a Great Person gift to a City-State.

[ICON_BULLET]+50% Range for Caravans. +300% for the efficiency of your trade routes spread the home city's religion. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith from every Oasis.

[ICON_BULLET]When declaring friendship, Sweden and their friend gain a +10% boost to [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person generation and +10% of the other's [ICON_RESEARCH] research. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Every 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in Small Cities (6+ Population) provide +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science Output.
[ICON_BULLET]+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for all Specialists. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for all Great Person tile improvements.

After researching Theology, receive a [ICON_RESEARCH] tech boost each time a scientific building / Wonder is built in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. Also receive a bonus Great Person at the end of every Maya Long Count calendar cycle (every 394 years in game, not true!). Each bonus person can only be chosen once for the first round.

[ICON_BULLET]Units move through Forest and Jungle in friendly territory as if they were Roads.These tiles can be used to establish [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connections upon researching The Wheel. Caravans move along Forest and Jungle as if they were Roads. All Land Units double the movement in Forest and Jungle. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forest will not be removed when a farm has been built.

[ICON_BULLET]Receive [ICON_GOLD] Gold bonus for discovering a Natural Wonder (bonus enhanced if first to discover it) and tile yields from Natural Wonders are doubled. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Natural Wonder Within 2 ring plots -50% corruption score of this City. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output for each source of [ICON_RES_COW] Cattle and [ICON_RES_BISON] Bison.

[ICON_BULLET]Units ignore terrain costs when moving into any tile with Hills.Civilian units can enter mountain tiles. No maintenance costs for improvements in Hills; half cost elsewhere. Workers can remove [ICON_RES_SHEEP] Sheep on the tiles with Hills. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Settlers will not lose HP if end turns on mountain tiles, and can build cities on them.Mountain cities gain additional [ICON_RESEARCH]science and [ICON_FOOD]food, which increases over eras.
[ICON_BULLET]Receive a free Social Policy when you advance to the next era.
[ICON_BULLET]Receive free Great Scientist when you discover Writing. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Earn Great Scientists 50% faster.
[ICON_BULLET]Tourism [ICON_TOURISM] output is +100% during their Golden Ages. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Earn Great Artists, Musicians, and Writers 50% faster during their Golden Ages.
